text.tspan: Main components of an oracle DB
ensuring the DB logic. There is a
clear distinction between the instance providing DB
Features and the database only ensuring persistence of data
All run time processes (background, server …) and memory zones (SGA, PGA …)
system global area memory containing data structures accessible to all Database
program global area : memory dedicated to each server/background process
database writer process, persists blocks from buffer cache
redo log writer process, persist redo logs
handles user requests (as many as connections)
client side process connecting to a server process
accepts new connections and creates server processes
Oracle scripts for common task can be found in <oracle_home>/rdbms/admin
blocks, redo log ...) => most things are represented as a table or is stored in blocks.
Read consistency is based on undo which are "normal" tables, indexes are tables storing
row ids. Many control data (dictionary cache, stats …) are viewed as tables.
Elegant design : oracle builds many of its advanced features on top of its very core
